channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The ‘shadow AI economy’ is booming: Workers at 90% of companies say they use chatbots, but most of them are hiding it from IT
item.description: “This ‘shadow AI’ often delivers better ROI than formal initiatives and reveals what actually works for bridging the divide,” MIT’s Project NANDA foun...

item.title: Are Marathons and Other Extreme Running Linked to Colon Cancer?
item.description: A small, preliminary study found that marathoners were much more likely to have precancerous growths. Experts aren’t sure why.

item.title: The Real Meaning of the Zelensky Summit Was Not as It Appeared
item.description: And while we’re at it, let’s think about the phrase “land swap.”

item.title: Why Did Shari Redstone Give Up Control of Paramount?
item.description: The media mogul spoke at length for the first time about selling her family’s empire, Paramount’s settlement with President Trump — and getting her re...

item.title: Sergey Brin told Google’s AI workers that working 60 hours a week is the ‘sweet spot’
item.description: "I think we have all the ingredients to win this race, but we are going to have to turbocharge our efforts."

item.title: Europe’s Leaders Headed Off Giveaway to Putin, but Emerged Without a Clear Path
item.description: The leaders dropped everything to travel to Washington to ensure President Trump didn’t force a bad deal on Ukraine. A road map for peace remains elus...

item.title: Sam Altman might be right: He’s not the only one who thinks the stock market is in ‘bubble’ territory
item.description: A company with a chatbot that often gets things wrong is somehow about to become the largest unicorn earth has ever seen. That does feel frothy.

item.title: Netanyahu Faces Pressure From Far Right Over New Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire Proposal
item.description: Some members of Israel’s coalition have ruled out a proposed hostage deal with Hamas, but the prime minister has yet to state his position.

item.title: Exclusive: Anthony Scaramucci’s SkyBridge Capital to tokenize $300 million on Avalanche
item.description: The onetime Goldman Sachs executive and White House communications director has been a crypto booster for years.

item.title: Home Depot leads Dow higher as Wall Street holds steady in summer lull
item.description: The S&P 500 slipped 0.2% and remains near its all-time high set last week. The Dow was up 68 points, or 0.2%, as of 9:35 a.m. ET, and the Nasdaq compo...

item.title: Macron Calls Putin an ‘Ogre at Our Doorstep’
item.description: The remarks were a considerable shift in sentiment between President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia and France’s president, Emmanuel Macron, who called M...

item.title: Securing Postwar Ukraine, Even With Trump’s Pledge to Help, Is Complex
item.description: Russia seems unlikely to agree to Western troops in Ukraine as part of any deal to end the war.

item.title: Netanyahu Faces Pressure From Far Right Over New Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire Proposal
item.description: Some members of Israel’s coalition have ruled out a proposed hostage deal with Hamas, but the prime minister has yet to state his position.

item.title: Live Updates: Trump Says U.S. Won’t Send Peacekeeping Troops to Ukraine
